job_description: Data Center Operations Analyst (Temporary Assignment) - job post Los Angeles County Office of Education 185 reviews Downey, CA 90242 • Hybrid remote $8,494 - $10,547 a month -  Full-time, Part-time, Temporary You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Salary $8,494 - $10,547 a month Job Type Full-time Part-time Temporary Bulletin An equal opportunity employer fostering a workforce that embraces and reflects the rich diversity of Los Angeles County Data Center Operations Analyst (Temporary Assignment) $48.82 to $60.61 OPPORTUNITY FOR TEMPORARY EMPLOYMENT Online applications must be submitted by: 4/14/23 5:00 P.M. (Pacific) Most temporary positions do not include benefits or paid time off except as provided by law. The Los Angeles County Office of Education is seeking network engineer professionals for a temporary assignment for an approximate three months. The Data Center Operations Analyst performs production control and operation support functions, prepares schedules, initiates runs, and resolves production control problems; provides technical support to professional and managerial staff in Technology Services within the area of job scheduling and production. Individuals interested in full-time and part-time work are welcome to apply! The Well Qualified Candidate Will Possess the Following Knowledge: Principles, practices, and techniques of working with enterprise mainframe computer systems and related job control languages (JCL) Automated job scheduling and production control practices and techniques Data processing and data center principles, practices, and terminology Project management and coordination techniques Principles and practices of disaster recovery Principles and practices of recordkeeping and maintaining documentation Competencies: Critical Thinking – Analytically and logically evaluating information, propositions, and claims Professional & Technical Expertise – Applying technical subject matter to the job Using Technology – Working with electronic hardware and software applications Attention to Detail – Focusing on the details of work content, work steps, and final work products Handling Stress – Maintaining emotional stability and self-control under pressure, challenge, or adversity Self-Management – Showing personal organization, self-discipline, and dependability Informing – Proactively obtaining and sharing information Customer Focus – Attending to the needs and expectation of customers Involving Others – Engaging others for input, contribution, and shared responsibility for outcomes Teamwork – Collaborating with others to achieve shared goals Cultural Proficiency – Modeling communications and interactions that respect and include all individuals and their languages, abilities, religions and cultures Required Education and Experience Education: Associate's degree or equivalent units (60 semester or 90 quarter) in Computer Science, Information Technology or a field related to the job requirements of this classification from an institution of higher learning recognized by the Council of Higher Education Accreditation. Foreign degrees and credit units require translation and equivalency established by an agency recognized by the Commission on Teacher Credentialing. Experience: Five years of experience supporting and managing data within a large-scale enterprise systems environment. Additional Requirements: A valid California driver's license and availability of private transportation or ability to provide transportation between job sites is required. Positions in this classification may be assigned to work a non-standard workweek and be subject to on-call duty 24 hours, 7 days a week. Hybrid remote schedules may be available. To ensure the health and safety of its staff, LACOE may require employees to provide evidence of full vaccination against COVID-19. Selection Process Candidates who meet the minimum requirements above will be forwarded to the supervisor for their consideration. Contact For information about the examination process you may send an e-mail to Shawn Toyohara at toyohara_shawn@lacoe.edu For general inquiries please call 562.803.8360 (Mon- Fri 8:00 am - 5:00 pm) For complete application information, please go to https://www.lacoe.edu/pc LACOE Personnel Commission, 9300 Imperial Hwy, EC-Annex, Downey, CA 90242 Based on full-time assignment: Although new employees usually begin at the first salary step, advanced salary step placement may be requested 12 vacation days per year, 18 after 7 years of service 14 paid holidays per year 12 paid sick days annually Insurance includes health, medical, dental, vision and group life Retirement CALPERS combined with Social Security, and pre-tax retirement savings account options

Research Analyst II (Data to Action Services Project) - job post R.L. KLEIN & ASSOCIATES. 600 S Commonwealth Ave, Los Angeles, CA 90005 $5,671 a month -  Full-time, Temporary Apply now Apply now save-icon Job details Salary $5,671 a month Job Type Full-time Temporary We are looking for a Research Analyst to ensure that surveillance data is used to optimize prevention, care and treatment programming, the local HIV and STD epidemics are characterized using high quality data, surveillance and epidemiological data are rapidly available and widely used for data-to-care and other decision making, and that data partnerships between technical teams are strengthened and synergized. In this role, you will ensure the local HIV epidemic is characterized using high quality data, HIV surveillance and epidemiological data are rapidly available and widely used for data-to-care and other decision making, and that data partnerships between technical teams are strengthened and synergized. Primary Responsibilities will include: · Perform data matches/record linkages between HIV/STD surveillance databases and other disease registries; and · Prepare data visualization materials and data dashboards using Power BI for sharing surveillance data internally and externally; and · Assist with surveillance-based data-to care activities, including prioritizing case follow-up, performing record searches to identify cases that are truly out of care, performing quality control activities, and coordinating with the Linkage and Reengagement Program; and · Work with the perinatal HIV team to develop tools to ensure complete reporting and follow-up of HIV-exposed infants; and · Collaborate with programmatic and HIV prevention managers to provide data materials that can be optimized for public health response; and · Participate in community meetings, quality assurance activities, Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) conference calls, required trainings, staff meetings, and other project activities, as needed. Minimum Qualifications: · Master’s degree in public health or health administration fields. · Valid California driver’s license, proof of vehicle insurance, and reliable transportation, or ability to secure timely transportation for off-site travel to various community sites throughout Los Angeles County as needed. · Experience with electronic medical records, healthcare data system, data quality assurance, and disease surveillance. · Excellent interpersonal and communication skills. Desirable Qualifications: · Experience with SAS programming or other statistical software. · Knowledge of HIV diseases, laboratory diagnostic technologies, and reporting regulations. · Ability to work independently with minimal supervision Contact us: For immediate consideration, contact us at (888) 755-5629 Job Types: Full-time, Temporary Pay: $5,671.00 per month Benefits: Dental insurance Health insurance Schedule: Monday to Friday Work Location: In person Health insurance If you require alternative methods of application or screening, you must approach the employer directly to request this as Indeed is not responsible for the employer's application process.
